abstract: Supreme Court judge Vassiliki Thanou is appointed to lead Greece until September elections; first woman to serve as prime minister, she replaces Alexis Tsipras, who resigned over lack of support for austerity measures sought by country's creditors.
lead_paragraph: Greece’s top Supreme Court judge was appointed caretaker prime minister on Thursday and will lead the country until elections next month.

headline.print_headline: Europe; Greece: Interim Leader Is Appointed

snippet: Greece’s top Supreme Court judge was appointed caretaker prime minister on Thursday and will lead the country until elections next month.
